title: What is the purpose of Coachella? - Quora

response.answer_text: The main purpose of Coachella is to provide a platform to all sorts of creators and performers that can showcase their work to an eclectic mix of audience – those willing to spend their hard earned money to curb their hunger for art. Coachella is a haven for all to gather and share their love for music, make new friends, rekindle old ones in a span of 3 straight days. It forces you to get out of your routine, make your way to the desert and enjoy live performances from noon till dusk the next day. It gives you the space to be with nature, basking in the perfect April sunlight in the day and getting slightly punished by the sandy winds matched by the radical drop in temperature at night, in typical desert fashion. It reminds you of the beauty that humans can be from all walks of life, and the beauty that humans can create, with sound, with words, with endless resources that we can find. Coachella reminds us of our better selves, if we just listen and let the music lead the way.

Coachella showcases popular and established musical artists as well as emerging artists and reunited groups. It is one of the largest, most famous, and most profitable music festivals in the United States and the world. Each Coachella staged from 2013 to 2015 set new records for festival attendance and gross revenues. The 2017 festival was attended by 250,000 people and grossed $114.6 million. Coachella's success led to Goldenvoice establishing additional music festivals at the site.
